reasoning: This describes the overall methodological approach used in the research.
This is the main problem or task that the research aims to address.
This is a mathematical framework used to model the reinforcement learning problem.
This describes a specific type of problem that the research focuses on.
This refers to the representation of the environment used in model-based RL.
This is another term for the model, emphasizing its role in simulating the environment.
This is an alternative approach to RL that does not use a model.
This refers to a model that is not perfectly accurate.
This refers to the actual interactions with the real environment used for learning.
This describes the specific algorithm proposed in the research, combining aspects of model-based and model-free RL.
This refers to the process of assessing the performance of different policies.
This refers to small adjustments made to the policy based on the model's suggestions.
This describes the desired level of performance achieved by the algorithm.
This refers to the actual environment where the policy is tested.
This refers to the experimental findings obtained in the research.
This emphasizes the low accuracy of the model used in the experiments.
